comment: Dr. Suarez is very sweet. She drops on lab and one pop quiz. She posts a rubric for her lab reports, so if you follow them you will have no issue getting A's on the reports. Her pre-lab quizzes can be pretty difficult, so be sure to prepare well by reading the protocols and the powerpoints. Her final is written by her, GO TO HER REVIEW SESSION!!

She is a really tough grader when it comes to lab reports . There are 3-4 pop quizzes . You do have to put in a lot of effort and time if you want to do well in her class . She takes forever to grade lab reports.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Suarez is not the worst KSU professor&some of these comments are too extreme. I took Dr. Alexander for lecture (C) & A in lab. Dr. Suarez was very understanding. I went to office hours. She does take forever to grade. Loves ochem. Drops lowest quiz, lowest lab, 2 optional labs replace 2 lowest labs. Go to final review session & you will pass!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Would take again

comment: Still have only received two report grades out of ten and no grade on the final yet which was a week ago. Sweet lady but not prepared at all to be a lab professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Suarez is a decent professor. However, it was her first semester so it came with challenges. We did not have a clear grading rubric or feedback until we were 3 months deep into the semester. She gives quizzes that are open book and final Is open book, so just prepare well for each lab. Prelab lectures take a very long time.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Suarez is very unorganized. She withheld grades until AFTER withdrawal period. We had no grades to decide if we wanted to stay in the class or not. You have to wait on an email each week to even know what to prepare for the next lab and she only just started sending out grading rubrics. 10/10 would not recommend!!! DO NOT TAKE.

Dr. Suarez has almost no idea of what she is doing. She will spend half the lab lecturing and conversing, then rush you to try and finish the lab. She returned our first grades halfway through the course, and has vague grading requirements. She never returns your papers. Most of lab was run by the TA because she doesn't know answers to questions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Suarez waste time in the lab causing not enough time for the actual experiment. Also doesnt give grades back until halfway through the semester, nor are they posted online. She is very condescending and often disagrees with the TA. AVOID AVOID AVOID.

Dr. Suarez is a terrible professor. She values her reputation over her students. Will withhold grades until after drop/add to make sure students don't drop her class. Condescending, strict grader, expects students to already know ochem concepts. She will be friendly to you one day, and the next will do a complete 180 and chew you out over anything.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: An absolutely terrible choice for lab. Didn't grade anything for over 3 months, and she's awful at responding to emails. AVOID!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Suarez is the worst professor I have ever had. She gives very little, and highly unspecific guidelines for lab reports and deducts points for items that she felt were "implied." She didn't grade anything for the first 3.5 months of class, against rubrics we dont see & she has little office hours at obscure hours and is horrible at returning emails!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very bad at communication. Grades were not given for the lab reports for several months into the semester. She graded us on a strict rubric and expected things out of us which we were not told about. in her words, they're "implied". You could ask her for help but she tends to go off on tangents and ends up not answering your questions anyway

Terrible communication. Changes her mind last minute way too often. Doesn't give lab grades until almost four months into the semester. Grades off a strict rubric but doesn't give the students one so you don't know what she's looking for. Do not take her. I'd rate her a zero but I can't. Yeah she's nice but you're paying for a teacher not a friend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--SO MANY PAPERS
